ai-snp3.9:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.
ai-snp3.9:1.3_0: Now at that time several very well-known brahmins were residing in Icchānaṅgala. They included
ai-snp3.9:1.4_0: the brahmins Caṅkī, Tārukkha, Pokkharasāti, Jāṇussoṇi, Todeyya, and others.
ai-snp3.9:1.5_0: Then as the brahmin students Vāseṭṭha and Bhāradvāja were going for a walk they began a discussion regarding the question of
ai-snp3.9:2.2_0: “When you’re well born on both your mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation.”
ai-snp3.9:3.2_0: “When someone is ethical, that’s how it is defined.”
ai-snp3.9:3.3_0: But neither was able to persuade the other.
ai-snp3.9:4.1_0: Then the student Vāseṭṭha addressed the student Bhāradvāja, (saying):
ai-snp3.9:4.2_0: “Master Bhāradvāja, the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—is staying in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.
ai-snp3.9:4.4_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-snp3.9:4.5_0: Come, let’s go to see him.
ai-snp3.9:4.5_1: and having approached the ascetic Gotama let us ask him about this matter,
ai-snp3.9:4.6_0: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”
ai-snp3.9:5.1_0: Then the Vāseṭṭha and Bhāradvāja approached the Fortunate One,
ai-snp3.9:5.1_1: and after going, they exchanged greetings with the Fortunate One
ai-snp3.9:5.2_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side,
ai-snp3.9:5.3_0: and Vāseṭṭha addressed the Buddha in verse:
